00020 Preprocessor::Preprocessor ()
00021     : optimalThreshold_(0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_(255),
00022     noiseRemovalTime_(0.0), optimalThresholdComputingTime_(0.0), backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_(0.0)

00033 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::computeOptimalThreshold (const Clip &clip)
00034 {
00035     // Start timing
00036     boost::timer timer;
00037     timer.restart();
00038     
00039     
00040     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00041     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00042     
00043     
00044     // Start with an initial threshold
00045     optimalThreshold_ = backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00046     unsigned char currentThreshold = not optimalThreshold_; // Enforces current threshold to be different so the firts loop is always made
00047     
00048     
00049     // Loop as many times as needed to find the optimal threshold by averaging the pixel gray levels
00050     while (currentThreshold not_eq optimalThreshold_)
00051     {
00052         unsigned int backgroundMeanValue = 0, objectsMeanValue = 0;
00053         unsigned int nSamples = 0;
00054         
00055         std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00056         
00057         // Compute the background and objects mean values
00058         for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00059         {
00060             unsigned char grayLevel = *pixelsIterator;
00061             
00062             if ( grayLevel >= optimalThreshold_ )
00063             {
00064                 backgroundMeanValue += grayLevel;
00065                 nSamples++;
00066             }
00067             else
00068                 objectsMeanValue += grayLevel;
00069         }
00070         backgroundMeanValue = round(backgroundMeanValue / nSamples);
00071         objectsMeanValue = round(objectsMeanValue / (clip.nPixels() - nSamples));
00072 
00073 
00074         // Update the optimal threshold keeping the last one
00075         currentThreshold = optimalThreshold_;
00076         optimalThreshold_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round((objectsMeanValue + backgroundMeanValue) / 2) );
00077     }
00078     
00079     // Gather elapsed time
00080     optimalThresholdComputingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00081     
00082     return optimalThreshold_;
00083 };

00085 
00091 const unsigned char &Preprocessor::findBackgroundReferenceGrayLevel (const Clip &clip, const unsigned int &referenceGrayLevelNeighbours)
00092 {
00093     // Start timing
00094     boost::timer timer;
00095     timer.restart();
00096     
00097     
00098     // Get the pixels of the clip (this is faster than calling clip.getPixelGrayLevel() each time)
00099     std::vector<unsigned char> pixels = clip.pixels();
00100     
00101     
00102     // Compute clip histogram
00103     std::vector<unsigned int> histogram(256, 0);
00104     std::vector<unsigned char>::iterator pixelsIterator;
00105     
00106     for ( pixelsIterator = pixels.begin(); pixelsIterator not_eq pixels.end(); ++pixelsIterator )
00107         histogram[*pixelsIterator] += 1;
00108     
00109         
00110     // Search the more frequent level of gray
00111     std::vector<unsigned int>::iterator histogramIterator;
00112     unsigned char moreFrequentGrayLevel = 0, levelCounter = 0;
00113 
00114     for (histogramIterator = histogram.begin(); histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end(); ++histogramIterator, ++levelCounter)
00115     {
00116         if ( *histogramIterator > histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel] )
00117             moreFrequentGrayLevel = levelCounter;
00118     }
00119     unsigned int referenceGrayLevel = moreFrequentGrayLevel * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00120 
00121 
00122     // Search the neighbours of the more frequent level of gray
00123     std::vector<unsigned int>::reverse_iterator histogramReverseIterator( std::find (histogram.rbegin(), histogram.rend(), histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel])++ );
00124     histogramIterator = histogramReverseIterator.base()++;
00125     unsigned int nFrequencies = histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel];
00126 
00127     for ( unsigned int i = 1; i <= referenceGrayLevelNeighbours; ++i )
00128     {
00129         // Search forwards
00130         if ( histogramIterator not_eq histogram.end() )
00131         {
00132             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel + i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00133             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel + i];
00134 
00135             ++histogramIterator;
00136         }
00137 
00138         // Search backwards
00139         if ( histogramReverseIterator not_eq histogram.rend() )
00140         {
00141             referenceGrayLevel  += (moreFrequentGrayLevel - i) * histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00142             nFrequencies        += histogram[moreFrequentGrayLevel - i];
00143 
00144             ++histogramReverseIterator;
00145         }
00146     }
00147 
00148     // Set the background reference gray level found
00149     backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ = static_cast<unsigned char>( round(referenceGrayLevel / nFrequencies) );
00150     
00151     // Gather elapsed time
00152     backgroundReferenceGrayLevelFindingTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00153     
00154     return backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_;
00155 };

00163 void Preprocessor::removeIsolatedNoise (Clip &clip, const unsigned int &isolationCoefficient)
00164 {
00165     // Start timing
00166     boost::timer timer;
00167     timer.restart();
00168     
00169     
00170     // Loop over the clip to remove every noisy isolated pixel
00171     for (unsigned int i=0; i < clip.height(); ++i)
00172     {
00173         for (unsigned int j=0; j < clip.width(); ++j)
00174         {
00175             unsigned char pixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(i, j);
00176             
00177             // Comparison values to avoid pixels that clearly belong to the background
00178             bool backgroundPixelOnWhite = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel > backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00179             bool backgroundPixelOnBlack = (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (pixelGrayLevel < backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00180             
00181             if ( not backgroundPixelOnBlack and not backgroundPixelOnWhite )
00182             {
00183                 unsigned int nBackgroundPixels = 0, nPixels = 0;
00184 
00185                 // Explore the pixel neighbourhood
00186                 for(int p = i-1; p < static_cast<int>(i+2); p++)
00187                 {
00188                     for(int q = j-1; q < static_cast<int>(j+2); q++)
00189                     {
00190                         // Comparison values to avoid step outside the image and the central pixel
00191                         bool heightOverflow = (p < 0) or (p >= static_cast<int>(clip.height()));
00192                         bool widthOverflow  = (q < 0) or (q >= static_cast<int>(clip.width()));
00193                         bool isCentralPixel = (p == static_cast<int>(i)) and (q == static_cast<int>(j));
00194                         
00195                         if ( not heightOverflow and not widthOverflow and not isCentralPixel )
00196                         {
00197                             // Update pixels counter
00198                             nPixels++;
00199 
00200                             // Get neighbour pixel gray level
00201                             unsigned char neighbourPixelGrayLevel = clip.getPixelGrayLevel(p, q);
00202 
00203                             // When background gray level is close to white but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00204                             if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ > optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel > optimalThreshold_) )
00205                                 nBackgroundPixels++;
00206                             else
00207                             {
00208                                 // When background gray level is close to black but not the pixel, update the noisy neighbours counter
00209                                 if ( (backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_ < optimalThreshold_) and (neighbourPixelGrayLevel < optimalThreshold_) )
00210                                     nBackgroundPixels++;
00211                             }
00212                         }
00213                     }
00214                 }
00215 
00216                 // Clear the noisy pixel if it is isolated
00217                 if (nBackgroundPixels >= (nPixels - isolationCoefficient))
00218                     clip.setPixelGrayLevel(i, j, backgroundReferenceGrayLevel_);
00219             }
00220         }
00221     }
00222     
00223     // Gather elapsed time
00224     noiseRemovalTime_ = timer.elapsed();
00225 };
